subject: Luge Racing
lead_paragraph: Felix Loch of Germany became the youngest men’s luge world champion on Saturday. Loch, 18, a two-time junior world champion, finished the first run in 44.996 seconds and won gold in 1:30.643 in Oberhoff, Germany. In a German sweep, David Möller was second (1:30.717), followed by Andi Langenhan (1:30.814).
